meanings.definition: The state of having two feet.
meanings.sent1: Her bipedality allowed her to walk upright like a human.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the bipedality of dinosaurs to understand their movement.
meanings.sent3: The alien found bipedality fascinating and tried to imitate it with its tentacles.
meanings.sent4: In a world of four-legged creatures, his bipedality made him stand out.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's bipedality was a milestone in his development.

meanings.definition: The quality or characteristic of being a biped.
meanings.sent1: The bipedality of the robot allowed it to navigate the stairs easily.
meanings.sent2: The bipedality of humans distinguishes them from many other animals.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character's bipedality made it easier for him to dance.
meanings.sent4: Her grace and bipedality on the runway impressed the judges.
meanings.sent5: The bipedality of the statue gave it a sense of movement and life.

meanings.definition: The act of walking on two feet.
meanings.sent1: His bipedality was evident as he strolled confidently down the street.
meanings.sent2: The study of bipedality in early humans sheds light on our evolutionary history.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's attempt at bipedality on land was comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The robot's flawless bipedality was a marvel of engineering.
meanings.sent5: The circus performer's skillful bipedality on the tightrope amazed the audience.
